message: I know a lot about Python, but I'm learning a lot in this pickle talk

The friendfeed folks would store pickled objects in Mysql blobs to keep performance fast.
It's not searchable that way, but you don't construct / interpolated objects either.

My understanding was that, because pickle needs to do stuff like imports, it's basically impossible… But I could be entirely wrong

Would have liked to see more about the problems with pickling classes (where you have to customize the process to eliminate bits that can't be pickled).  That's where we've run into problems.
@j2d2 that's essentially what RelStorage does (an alternative ZODB backend)
